text: The District of Columbia adopts the Compact for Education of the Education Commission of the States ("Compact") and becomes a member of the Education Commission of the States ("Commission").
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 31-2301.

Legislative History of Laws

Law 5-65, "Education Commission of the States Participation Act of 1983," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-270, which was referred to the Committee on Education. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 20, 1983, and January 3, 1984, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 11, 1984, it was assigned Act No. 5-98 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

Miscellaneous Notes

Short title: The first section of D.C. Law 5-65 provided: "That this act may be cited as 'Education Commission of the States Participation Act of 1983'."

chapter.text: Compact for Education of the Education Commission of the States.

heading.catch_text: Adopted; District membership in Commission approved.
